page.title: 04Wray Endowed School: History
page.content: Wray School, endowed by Captain Richard Pooley, was built in 1684 and rebuilt in 1885. The original datestone was replaced above the front door. Captain Pooley left Â£20 in his will towards the building of a school on his land at Weind Head, Wray, and Â£200 to be invested in land. The income from this investment was to be paid to the schoolmaster 'for ever'. According to tradition, Richard Pooley and his brother were abandoned, when young, by their father, on a journey taking cows from Wray to Coventry. Luckily, a rich lady found them and looked after them. Richard joined Cromwell's army and became a captain. After the Civil War, he returned to Wray and invited all the women to a feast at the inn and there, mother and son were reunited. He stayed in Wray for the rest of his life.
